Event.name: Delivery
Event.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Deliverer</fen> hands off a <fen>Theme</fen> to a <fen>Recipient</fen> or (more indirectly) a <fen>Goal</fen> location, which is accessible to the <fen>Recipient</fen>.
<ex><fex name="del">The staff of Ebags</fex> <t>delivered</t> <fex name="Theme">the umbrella</fex> <fex name="Time">well ahead of schedule</fex>.</ex>
<ex>In each class <fex name="del">a dove</fex> flew in and <t>delivered</t> <fex name="Theme">a red rose</fex> <fex name="rec">to Ginny</fex>.</ex>
<ex>The Pontifical Delegation for the <t>delivery</t> <fex name="Theme">of the Icon of the Kazan Mother of God</fex> will arrive tomorrow. </ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Deliverer
Arg.definition:
<def-root>This is the person who completes the movement of the <fen>Theme</fen> after having transported it.
<ex>That afternoon, <fex name="del">a staff courier</fex> <t>delivered</t> the box from St. Petersburg to Largo.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Goal
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The end of the path and intended goal of the sending.
<ex>I <t>delivered</t> the packages <fex name="Goal">to the storage room</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Theme
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The objects being delivered.
<ex>I <t>delivered</t> <fex name="Theme">the documents</fex> to the court house.</ex> </def-root>

Arg.name: Vehicle
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The vehicle employed by the <fen>Deliverer</fen>.
<ex>I polished it until the last blemish had vanished, then <t>delivered</t> it <fex name="veh">by wheelbarrow</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Depictive
Arg.definition:
<def-root>Depictive phrase describing the <fen>Deliverer</fen> or <fen>Theme</fen>
<ex>They <t>delivered</t> my cable box <fex name="dep">broken</fex> three times.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition:
<def-root>Any description of the delivery event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including epistemic modification (<ment>probably</ment>, <ment>presumably</ment>, <ment>mysteriously</ment>), secondary effects (<ment>quietly, loudly</ment>), and general descriptions comparing events (<ment>the same way</ment>). It may also indicate salient characteristics of the <fen>Deliverer</fen> that affect the action (<ment>presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully</ment>).
<ex> As was customary, she had <fex name="man">eagerly</fex> <t>delivered</t> the morning paper to her parents' room</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Recipient
Arg.definition:
<def-root>This is the <fen>Recipient</fen> of the sent <fen>Theme</fen>.
<ex>Tess <t>delivered</t> a package <fex name="rec">to Abby and her kitty</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Purpose
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Purpose</fen> of the delivery.
<ex>Rachel <t>delivered</t> the letter to her mother <fex name="Purpose">to see how she would react on getting it</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Explanation
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Explanation</fen> for the delivery.
<ex>Letters are generally <t>delivered</t> in the morning <fex name="exp">because that's when most people are home</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition:
<def-root>When the delivery takes place
<ex>I <t>delivered</t> the letter to you <fex name="Time">last week</fex>, Sir.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Cotheme
Arg.definition:
<def-root>An additional theme delivered along with the main <fen>Theme</fen>.
<ex> I ordered a cappuccino and he <t>delivered</t> it <fex name="CT">along with a ricebubble sweet snack</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Container
Arg.definition:
<def-root>A container in which the <fen>Theme</fen> is delivered.
<ex>We <t>delivered</t> the roses <fex name="con">in a beautiful vase</fex> as you requested.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Place
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The location at which the delivery takes place.
<ex>Barney <t>delivered</t> the letter on Monday <fex name="Place">in Sheboygan</fex></ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Speed
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Speed</fen> at which the <fen>Deliverer</fen> delivers the <fen>Theme</fen>.
<ex>This service is for our clients who need <fex name="spe">speedy</fex> <t>delivery</t> of their goods.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Circumstances
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The conditions under which the delivery takes place.
<ex>Purchases over $400 are <t>delivered</t> for free.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Source
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The location of the <fen>Theme</fen> before the delivery process begins.
<ex>We offer direct <t>delivery</t> of all of your packages <fex name="sou">from anywhere in the UK</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Means
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The Means are intermediate actions performed by the <fen>Deliverer</fen> in order to move the package to the <fen>Goal</fen>.
<ex>He always <t>delivers</t> the papers <fex name="mea">by tossing them through people's windows</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Path
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The path along which the <fen>Theme</fen> moves while being delivered.
<ex>He <t>delivered</t> it <fex name="pat">through the transom</fex> .</ex>
<ex>Oil <t>deliveries</t> were <m>made</m> <fex name="pat">along the interstate</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Beneficiary
Arg.definition: <def-root>The person for whom the Delivery action occurs. </def-root>

Arg.name: Event_description
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE applies to appraisals of the Delivery event. </def-root>

Arg.name: Period_of_iterations
Arg.definition: <def-root>The length of time from when the Delivery event began to be repeated to when it stopped.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: deliver.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: bring and hand over to the appropriate recipient.

lexUnit.name: delivery.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the action of delivering something, especially letters or goods.
